title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 02 January 2013 - XWiki
content:
<drsku> has quit  
00:21 <vmassol> has quit  
00:26 <drsku> has joined #xwiki  
00:48 <drsku> Why is installing XWiki so  full of problems. (See earlier posts for 3 attempts) Last attempt was to try the zip link given me by rrodriquez. It downloaded ok but about 45 sec from finishing unzip I got the message 0x0010135 path too long. I tried clicking the start\_wiki and the server ran but when I go to localhost:8080 I get This wizard will guide you through the process of installing, upgrading  
00:48 <drsku> or downgrading the XWiki distribution. You are seeing this wizard for one of the following reasons:  
00:48 <drsku>     the default wiki pages recommended for the current version of the XWiki runtime are not installed  
00:50 <drsku> so frankly I am about ready to give up on Xwiki. I have tried many wikis and cmses but never had this kind of silliness. Please encourage me to keep trying!!  
00:55 <cjd> if you're seeing that message, it sounds like the RC-1 release just plain failed. This doesn't usually happen and I'm testing it now.  
00:56 <cjd> One issue is it's New Year's day so nobody is at work today so things are only being handled by volunteers at home.  
00:57 <cjd> Note that RC-1 is a release candidate which means it's a beta test. Usually they are just fine which is why they are listed first on the download page but sometimes they have issues.  
01:00 <cjd> drsku: I have tested this version and can personally vouch for it: http://download.forge.objectweb.org/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise-jetty-hsqldb-4.3.1.zip  
01:01 <cjd> if issues persist with this version, check that your java installation is up to date.  
01:05 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
01:10 <vmassol> has quit  
01:20 <cjd> drsku: I just tested 4.4-rc-1 which was the link sdumitriu gave to you, it works fine for me.  
01:21 <cjd> Check the whole folder name of the folder which you unziped the file in to.  
01:21 <cjd> If it's something long like  C:\really\long\path\with\a\folder\inside\of\a\folder\inside\of\a\folder> then you might have just been unlucky enough to overrun the Windows limitation on file path length.  
01:30 <sdumitriu> Frankly, XWiki has the simplest installation process, which is usually painless  
01:30 <sdumitriu> But from time to time special issues arise  
01:31 <sdumitriu> And most of the times it's something very minor that makes everything fail  
01:31 <sdumitriu> The "path too long" error suggests that you're trying to install it someplace deep, hitting a Windows limitation  
01:49 <jvdrean> has quit

10:34 <GuillaumeF> has joined #xwiki  
10:37 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:59 <vmassol> good morning guys  
11:01 <vmassol> let's sort http://jira.xwiki.org/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&jqlQuery=fixVersion+=+%224.4%22+and+resolution+=+Unresolved  
11:02 <vmassol> so following the discusson of a few days ago I'm moving XWIKI-8630 to 4.5M1 ok?  
11:02 <vmassol> same for XWIKI-8461  
11:02 <vmassol> and XWIKI-8207  
11:03 <vmassol> actually moving them all to 4.5M1  
11:03 <vmassol> so that we can release 4.4 final tomorrow, XWIKI-8599 is not that important in this list and can be fixed in 4.5M1  
11:03 <vmassol> ok for you?  
11:04 <tmortagne> ok  
11:05 <vmassol> the reason I'm proposing this is because we don't have many devs avail and we're very late already, we need to move on  
11:05 <vmassol> sburjan`: ?  
11:05 <vmassol> hmm platform build is still failing, checking  
11:06 <vmassol> ok my fault, fixing  
11:16 <vmassol> moving issues  
11:17 <vmassol> so anything left before I start the 4.4 final release?  
11:20 <vmassol> jvdrean, sdumitriu, tmortagne, everyone: anything you absolutely need to commit in 4.4?  
11:21 <vmassol> if not, I'll start the release  
11:21 <sdumitriu> Go ahead  
11:21 <tmortagne> nothing I can think of on my side  
11:22 <vmassol> ok starting  
11:22 <jvdrean> same here  
12:13 <vmassol> tmortagne: I think this is for you http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/3097/console  
12:13 <vmassol> 6 checkstyle violations  
12:15 <tmortagne> looking, had issue with eclipsecs and forgot to enable it again for this project  
12:21 <GuillaumeF> has quit  
12:31 <Slashman> has quit  
12:35 <GuillaumeF> has joined #xwiki  
12:40 <helge> has joined #xwiki  
12:46 <helge> Hi, one question: I upgraded to XE 4.3.1 and have a problem with the new HTML5 attachment upload. The server always responds "The file ... is too large. Please chose a file under NaN undefined." This occurs only with the new widget. Any Ideas or can I disable the widget and have the old upload tool instead? Thx, helge.  
12:47 <helge> PS: I have Firefox 17.0 on a linux platform.  
12:47 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
12:56 <vmassol> helge: hmm that would be a question for sdumitriu I guess. I don't know much about the new html5 upload stuff, looks like a bug to me that you could report on jira.xwiki.org  
13:35 <helge> has quit  
13:35 <qwebirc66916> has joined #xwiki  
13:36 <qwebirc66916> vmassol: thanks, I raised the issue on jira.  
13:36 <vmassol> qwebirc66916: so helge was you? :)  
13:37 <vmassol> tmortagne: still 3 checkstyle violations it seems  
13:37 <vmassol> ah no  
13:37 <vmassol> something else  
13:37 <vmassol> "There are errors in the XAR XML files!"  
13:37 <tmortagne> checking  
13:38 <tmortagne> I may have forgotten to execute xar:format  
13:39 <qwebirc66916> vmassol: ehm - yes. had to re-login.  
13:39 <vmassol> ok  
13:39 <tmortagne> hmm no it's not that  
13:40 <vmassol> "- Parent must not be empty  
13:40 <vmassol> "  
13:40 <vmassol> xar:format cannot fix this  
13:40 <vmassol> you can run xar:verify to check  
14:12 <crocket> has joined #xwiki  
14:12 <crocket> Is it possible to attach a profiler to XWiki?  
14:20 <vmassol> !search profiler  
14:20 <vmassol> first link  
14:25 <vmassol> dashboard for 4.5= http://jira.xwiki.org/secure/Dashboard.jspa?selectPageId=11390  
14:26 <vmassol> guys please review http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Roadmaps/WebHome and add the jira issues to the roadmap  
14:38 <vmassol> release done!  
14:38 <vmassol> push to central in progress  
14:39 <vmassol> 2 hours to release in total, not bad  
14:39 <vmassol> including the email to ow2 to tell them to fix their issue ;)  
14:39 <vmassol> (the second one in 10 days)  
14:42 <vmassol> jvdrean, sdumitriu, cjd: could I get a vote from you for my mail about the new markdown impl  
14:42 <vmassol> ?
